column4: I'm having trouble setting up my Geforce 6200LE. I can only seem to get it booting in low graphics mode
use envy to get the drivers
envyng is the most recent  thing I've tried
so what happens?
try to use the manual mode in that... it helps
envyng -t; 1 (Install the NVIDIA driver) => correctly identifies my GeForce 6200 LE => restart => low graphics mode
try setting the resolution now
it tells me it's back using the vesa driver
were you able to use the res before?
sorry, I mean the low graphics mode dialog tells me that. I can set resolution up to 800x600
ok, I'm using envyng manual driver install rather than the automatic one, how should I know which of the 3 numbered drivers to use?
thats a difficult question... i use the number which is being shown to me when i boot the machine
let me try all 3 until one works
hmm
all 3 drivers end me up in low graphics land :(
do the restricted drivers help
you'll have to remind me how to check for those
System->Admin->Hardware drivers (assuming you are on 8.04)
No proprietary drivers are in use on this system
I just restarted my machine again, and hit the grub loader button. Apparently it was booting by default using the -server entry, Using the -generic entry it started up and seems to be working now :)
cool :)
